description: Shifts left when inverse Moebius transform applied twice.
comments: Equals eigensequence of triangle A127170 (the square of the inverse Mobius transform). [From _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 27 2009]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
formula: a(n+1) = Sum_{d divides n} tau(n/d)*a(d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 24 2003
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[ DivisorSigma[0, (n - 1)/d]*a[d], {d, Divisors[n - 1]}]; a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 43}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 12 2011, after Vladeta Jovovic *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
